notes: base lemma; plural 'edere' is rare, often uncountable
example_sentence_english: I grow ivy on the balcony.

notes: contraction of di + la; elision before vowel
example_sentence_english: The scent of the ivy is light.

notes: contraction of a + la; elision before vowel
example_sentence_english: I give water to the ivy every morning.

notes: contraction of da + la; elision before vowel
example_sentence_english: The leaves fall from the ivy.

notes: contraction of in + la; elision before vowel
example_sentence_english: The cat hides in the ivy.

notes: contraction of su + la; elision before vowel
example_sentence_english: The rain beats on the ivy.

notes: no contraction for con; uses l' before vowel
example_sentence_english: I decorate the balcony with the ivy.
I talk about the ivies in the garden.

example_sentence_italian: Do acqua alle edere ogni settimana.
example_sentence_english: I give water to the ivies every week.
I collect leaves from the ivies.

example_sentence_italian: Gli uccelli si nascondono nelle edere.
example_sentence_english: The birds hide in the ivies.
The snow stays on the ivies.

example_sentence_italian: Decoro la siepe con le edere.
example_sentence_english: I decorate the hedge with the ivies.
